DOC.brief_summary: The current study test single agent IL-2 stage IV melanoma kidney cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Trial Outpatient Intravenous Interleukin-2 Malignant Melanoma Metastatic Kidney Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: The current study test single agent IL-2 give daily 4 dos every 3 week total 12 dos outpatient set stage IV melanoma kidney cancer attempt determine response rate , long response last , median survival regimen two disease . Responding patient absence disease progression may receive additional cycle therapy every 3 week .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients must histologic diagnosis metastatic kidney cancer malignant melanoma Patients may either newly diagnose metastatic disease may receive prior treatment metastatic kidney cancer . 2 . Patients must measurable disease physical exam radiologic study . 3 . ECOG performance status 0 1 estimate survival least 3 month . 4 . White blood count > 3500/mm3 , platelet count > 100,000/mm3 , hemoglobin > 9.0 gm/dl ; bilirubin , ALT , AST < 2 x upper limit normal ; serum creatinine < 2.0 mg/dl . 5 . Patients must undergo lowlevel cardiac stress test ( similar cardiac evaluation dobutamine stress echocardiogram radionuclidebased stress test ) possible atherosclerotic heart disease . Patients positive stress test would exclude trial . 6 . Patients elevate temperature > 100.5 F must source occult infection exclude . 7 . Patients must felt recovered effect prior therapy , > 2 week prior chemotherapy . 1 . Medical illness require corticosteroid immunosuppressive agent ( cyclosporin methotrexate ) . 2 . Autoimmune disease inflammatory arthritis , could exacerbate immunebased therapy . 3 . Prior history psychiatric disorder , could exacerbate interleukin2 . 4 . Lactation pregnancy . 5 . Evidence significant cardiovascular disease include history recent ( < 6 month prior ) myocardial infarction , congestive heart failure , primary cardiac arrhythmia ( due electrolyte disorder drug toxicity , example ) beyond occasional PVC 's , angina , positive lowlevel stress test , cerebrovascular accident . 6 . Current brain metastasis .
